title: Barrett’s Esophagus with High-Grade Dysplasia
diagnosis_topic: Premalignant change in distal esophagus with high-grade dysplasia
setup_script: “A 48-year-old man with chronic gastroesophageal reflux disease undergoes surveillance endoscopy. The gastroenterologist notes a segment of salmon-colored mucosa in the distal esophagus. Biopsies are obtained, and pathology reports high-grade dysplasia. How would you proceed with this patient?”

dynamic_flow.reply: “Histology is reviewed by two independent GI pathologists, both confirming high-grade dysplasia without invasive carcinoma.”
“What treatment approaches are available for this patient?”

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident chooses endoscopic eradication therapy
dynamic_flow.reply: “Endoscopic mucosal resection is performed on nodular areas. Pathology confirms high-grade dysplasia without invasion. Radiofrequency ablation is then applied to the remaining Barrett’s segment. What is your surveillance plan?”
“Three months later, repeat endoscopy shows progression with nodularity and multifocal high-grade dysplasia. How do you proceed?”
“The patient presents six months later with dysphagia. Biopsies reveal intramucosal adenocarcinoma. What is your management now?”
“What operative approach would you consider, and why?”
“Please describe your operative steps for an Ivor Lewis or transhiatal esophagectomy.”
“Pathology reveals high-grade dysplasia throughout and no invasive carcinoma. The patient recovers uneventfully. How will you structure follow-up?”
“The patient is started on high-dose proton pump inhibitor therapy. What is the role of ongoing acid suppression?”
“The patient asks what changes he can make to reduce risk of recurrence or progression.”

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident asks about H. pylori

dynamic_flow.reply: “The patient asks about his risk of cancer in the future. How do you counsel him?”

critical_decision_points: Confirmation of high-grade dysplasia by expert pathology
Decision between endoscopic eradication therapy and surgical esophagectomy
Technical performance and intraoperative decision-making if esophagectomy is performed
Appropriate use of surveillance vs. intervention
Importance of acid suppression and lifestyle modification
Patient education and counseling on risk of progression
